front.title: Detecting Inactive Neighbors over OSPF Demand Circuits

abstract.t: OSPF is a link-state intra-domain routing protocol used in IP networks. OSPF behavior over demand circuits is optimized in RFC1793 to minimize the amount of overhead traffic. A part of OSPF demand circuit extensions is the Hello suppression mechanism. This technique allows a demand circuit to go down when no interesting traffic is going through the link.
